definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: You hurt my feelings by betraying me when I'm in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 你太伤我感情了，居然在我身陷困境之时背叛了我。

sentences.english: Is she disgusted that he would so soon betray Anna?
sentences.chinese: 她是否为他对安娜如此之快的背叛感到反感？

sentences.english: But they, like Adam, have transgressed the covenant, there have they dealt treacherously against me.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们在阿当就违犯了盟约，在那里已背叛了我。

sentences.english: You do not so serious to me, I'm afraid I will betray you.
sentences.chinese: 请你别对我那么认真，只怕我会背叛你。

sentences.english: For his own personal interest, Mr. Chen ratted on his government.
sentences.chinese: 陈先生为了个人利益，背叛了他的政府。

sentences.english: Anakin accused Padmé of betraying him, and used the Force the strangle her.
sentences.chinese: 阿纳金谴责帕德梅背叛他，并用原力掐她。

sentences.english: He wormed himself into my confidence and betrayed me after that.
sentences.chinese: 他渐渐骗取了我的信任，但随后背叛了我。

sentences.english: Not so long ago Japanese wives put up with any amount of infidelity and abuse.
sentences.chinese: 在不久前，日本的妻子们还忍受着各种背叛和虐待。

sentences.english: Centuries ago, mankind rebelled against God. The result was confusion.
sentences.chinese: 许多年前，人类背叛了上帝，结果就是变乱。

sentences.english: Becky had told him all, not forgetting her own treachery;
sentences.chinese: 贝基把自己的背叛以及泼墨水的事情全盘托出了。

sentences.english: Betray a friend, and you'll often find you have ruined yourself.
sentences.chinese: 背叛朋友，你也不会有好下场。

sentences.english: For loneliness is a friend who will not betray.
sentences.chinese: 而孤独是永不背叛你的朋友。

sentences.english: And I didn`t know what to answer, how to betray, confess, parry.
sentences.chinese: 我不知回答什么，不知怎样背叛，坦白和逃避开。

sentences.english: He promised never to betray the organization.

sentences.chinese: 世代交替的甜蜜，是否遭背叛？

definition: breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to betray/to desert/to defect from/to turn renegade
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to offer for sale/to sell/to sell out or betray
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
